projects.name: iCOM | World Wide
projects.summary:
• Effective time worked in the project:  23 months.
• Business Domain: Transport / Civil Aviation / Electronic Flight Bag.
• Technologies (OS Ubuntu 12): 
BackEnd: J2EE 7. Corporate Portal Liferay Portal EE 6.2. Tomcat Bundle.
Architecture SOA with Red Hat JBoss SOA­P 5, BPM.
FrontEnd: JS (Jquery and Alloy).
DBMS: MySQL.
GIS PostgreSQL­PostGIS 2.0
Mobility Application:
- Phase I: Objective­C, iOS7, CocoaPods, CoreData, iOS 7
- Beta Phase: Android 4.3.
GIS Viewer:
- Phase I: Maply ­ WhirlyGlobe
- Beta Phase: OpenLayers 2.12 on Android WebView
Geographic Data Server:
- Phase I: ETL module rendering maps Mapnik; Data processing with
GDAL, NumPy and GRASS. PaaS: Amazon Web Services. Docker Container.
- Beta Phase: Geoserver
Integration Environment (Jenkins, Sonar, Nexus, SVN, GIT)
Project Management: RedMine
• Methodology and standards: Scrum (Agile), INSPIRE, OGC,  ISO19915,  ISO19919.
• Responsibilities:
- Technical communications with Eurocontrol.
- Analysis and Implementation of User Requirements.
- Development of systems analysis in their technical phase. Drafting of relevant documentation.
- Development of a Map Viewer and its associated API for events management within the context of Mobile Application Webview.
- Development of the GIS back-end. Automatization of CRUD processes by PL/PgSQL.
- Design and Development of the Application Layer List.
- Portlet Development for Liferay portal.

references.name: Arnaud Héritier
references.reference:
It’s been a pleasure to work with Carlos for several years when I was managing the support team at CloudBees. 
He was really in the mindset to learn and share the knowledge acquired which is a key for a good support engineer. 
He also helped to automate some tasks like the provisioning of our environments used for interviews. 
Kudos Carlos!

references.name: Andrei Alexandru Gheorghe
references.reference:
It's difficult to find someone like Carlos in the DevOps world.

We worked together on implementing the Cloudbees CI, with me representing the customer, while Carlos was our designated support engineer. 
During our collaboration, Carlos had something like a super power to read minds, every time we had an issue, he came up with the solution at the same time we raised the issue, or even before.

I really felt that, whenever we discussed, we were completing each-other's ideas on the implementation. Carlos provided us with great documentation and even feature expansions, taking into account restrictions that applied to our environment, which were far from standard.
I will really miss our meetings and mindreading sessions :)

For all the above and more, Carlos earns my highest recommendation.

references.name: Juan Antonio Álvarez
references.reference: Carlos has carried out a very good project in our Web and Mobile software development Master. He has designed and deployed several Restful Web Services consumed by an iOS application in order to offer a simulated service for available tables in geo-located restaurants.

references.name: Diego Jordano Márquez
references.reference: Carlos was a great classmate. It is very pleasant to work with him, always gets the goals, works very well in a team and motivate others. It is a great coordinator and is always one step ahead.

references.name: Manuel Brey Giménez
references.reference:
Carlos ha impartido en BC3 Formación cursos de SIG, demostrando en todo momento su alta formación y experiencia en la materia, así como una gran implicación con la empresa y los alumnos.

Por parte de BC3 Formación, ha cumplido ampliamente nuestras expectativas, desarrollando su trabajo de manera seria y responsable. Por supuesto, cuenta con nuestra total confianza para futuras colaboraciones.

references.name: Cayetano Benavent Viñuales
references.reference: Carlos desarrolló las labores encomendadas de forma muy competente.

references.name: José Ramón Hernández
references.reference:
Trabajó en Cibernos en el departamento de SIG y demostró ser una persona muy competente en su puesto, cumpliendo todas las responsabilidades y tareas que se le encargaron. 

Es un gran Profesional, muy serio en su trabajo, responsable y posee muy buenas aptitudes y actitudes así como un gran  afan de superación.
 
Su conducta fue siempre la de una persona responsable y digna de toda confianza.

references.name: Simon Woddy
references.reference:
Carlos worked in my GIS team with Buro Happold Engineers Limited for two and half years between 2006 and 2009.  Throughout that time he worked conscientiously, both as part of the core team and independently, supporting projects with many different disciplines across the practise.

From the outset Carlos demonstrated a high degree of technical capability and consistently produced innovative solutions and excellent output.

He was a popular member of staff and I would not hesitate in recommending him for a position in any organisation.

work.name: CloudBees
work.summary:
- Designing and Review Statement of Work for Services Engagement with CloudBees customers
- Implementing Consulting activities in relation to Installation, Migration and Pipeline Development for CloudBees Products

work.name: CloudBees
work.summary:
- Dedicated CloudBees CI Consultant for EMEA customers subscribed to the Technical Success Manager Program. Customers located in Spain, France, Romania and Sweden for the following industries: Banks/Financial and IT Hardware Manufacturers.
- Providing expert advice about the following topics: CI Pipelines with Jenkins engine, Cloud (mainly AWS), Kubernetes, Containers
- Increasing adoption of CloudBees Enterprise Features on the the top of Open Source core
- Preparation/Presentation of Demos
- Contributor of the CloudBees certification program

work.name: CloudBees
work.summary:
- Lead position in the described responsibilities for the Senior Support Engineer role
- Advocating for CloudBees CI by creating media content (including demos) for CloudBees and Jenkins CI Blogs, focusing on Best Practices and Troubleshooting scenarios (refer to the linked pages)
- Tooling: Design, Development and Implementation for a Technical Simulation Framework for CloudBees Support Engineers candidates

work.name: CloudBees
work.summary:
- Support worldwide customers (focus on EMEA) in any Technical/Functional issues/aspects/questions about any of the product suite (see https://www.cloudbees.com/products) and those technologies capable of being integrated with CloudBees ecosystem (mainly Docker, AWS EC2, Kubernetes, Git SCM)
- Improve the quality of CloudBees Products and Jenkins Community by reproducing/reporting Bugs and Request For Enhancements.
- Groovy scripting automation task for customers.
- Contribution to Development of Support Tooling (mainly with JAVA, Bash scripting).
- One of the major contributor for the CloudBees Knowledge Base (see https://support.cloudbees.com/hc/en-us)
- Contributions to CloudBees Official Documentation (see https://go.cloudbees.com/docs/)
- Contributions to CloudBees Jenkins Engineer certification exam
- Collaboration across different Team within the company
- Interacting and Participation with the Jenkins community and CloudBees customers in worldwide  forums. FOSDEM 2018, 2019 and 2021 as well as  Jenkins World SF 2019.

Cases Management Lifecycle
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Triage > Understand Customer needs > Require Data > Analysis/Troubleshooting > Solution > Ensure Customer Satisfaction > Create Knowledge and/or Tooling
